title: Restore app name/identifier to match Version 14 (or lower) naming

requirements.text: Restore the appâ€™s visible name/branding everywhere it appears so it matches the naming used in Version 14 (or lower), and ensure the name is consistent across the app shell and UI. This includes at minimum the HTML document title and metadata, the boot fallback screen title text, and the in-app header/footer branding.

quotes: may be we have changed the name so please make it as used in v14 or lower

acceptanceCriteria: Browser tab title matches the Version 14 (or lower) app name.
Boot fallback screen title text uses the Version 14 (or lower) app name consistently.
In-app header branding text uses the Version 14 (or lower) app name consistently (including responsive variants like short names).
In-app footer branding text uses the Version 14 (or lower) app name consistently.
All user-facing naming text is in English.

requirements.text: Audit and revert any name-derived identifiers that can break loading when renamed (e.g., build identifier strings, hostname/app identifier derivations used in links, or other name-coupled values referenced at startup), restoring them to the Version 14 (or lower) values so the deployed app loads successfully.

quotes: may be we have changed the name so please make it as used in v14 or lower

acceptanceCriteria: No startup-time runtime errors are caused by missing/renamed name-derived identifiers.
The app successfully mounts (fires the existing `app-mounted` signal) and the boot fallback screen hides on a normal load.
Any build/version/identifier values shown in the UI remain present and do not prevent load when changed.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or anything under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing UI components instead).
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor; only add backend changes if strictly necessary for the naming rollback.
nonGoals: Adding new product features beyond restoring Version 14 (or lower) naming consistency.
Introducing third-party authentication providers or external databases/services.
